nodes.bodyText: How come this has such a "weird" name? I assume the module's pom.xml doesn't have the proper metadata?

nodes.bodyText: My script is trying to read that information from the quarkus-extension.yaml in the runtime module (https://github.com/quarkusio/jbang-catalog/blob/master/quarkusbuilditemdoc.java#L95).

nodes.bodyText:
That won't work. Some are not extensions but SPI modules and don't have a quarkus-extension.yaml.
I think it would be better to read the <name> from the pom file and normalize it a bit (remove Quarkus - , remove  - Deployment but typically keep the - SPI part).

nodes.bodyText: I don't think it should be a fallback. The POM names are very consistent and it's the best way to have something nice.
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText:
Can the script read the current HEAD and propose that instead of "master"
e.g proposing

"https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/d30c121757d8524a3d5eee6ed2dfcb956a094853/extensions/agroal/spi/src/main/java/io/quarkus/agroal/spi/JdbcDriverBuildItem.java" instead of
"https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/extensions/agroal/spi/src/main/java/io/quarkus/agroal/spi/JdbcDriverBuildItem.java"
?

nodes.bodyText: This way, we could just use the script proposed in the description of this PR to generate this file which will point to source of the latest releases (which is not master since it can contain changes that are not yet released). Moreover, we'll avoid committing this file since it can be generated. Much like what we have now for the configuration reference docs

nodes.bodyText:
Does this only list public classes ?
If a build item is not public, it's not designed to be used outside the extension

I think we need to provide inside Quarkus core an annotation to be able to restrict a BuildItem to be listed here, like @NotDocumented or @NotExposed or @Private.
Some build items are designed to be used inside the extension only, and they cannot be made package private always so we need a finer way to control the inclusion in the page.
